data.title: Speed and Agility Training in Webster
data.meta_description: Speed and agility training in Webster for youth athletes ages 8-18. Our trainers build better athletes.
data.text:
What is Strength & Conditioning?

Engaging in activities to improve performance by applying the general sports training principles of overload, reversibility, progression, individualization, periodization, and specificity. (ref 1, 2)

Why is Strength & Conditioning important?

To achieve their full potential, aspiring Athletes must understand proper posture, balance their movement patterns, build supporting and stabilizing muscle groups, improve mobility, and enhance their coordination. (ref 3)

How we train Strength & Conditioning?

Redline believes in age-appropriate strength and resistance training. We prioritize safety in every movement by focusing on proper mechanics first, followed by consistency, and then intensity.

What is Strength & Conditioning?

Engaging in activities to improve performance by applying the general sports training principles of overload, reversibility, progression, individualization, periodization, and specificity. (ref 1, 2)

Why is Strength & Conditioning important?

To achieve their full potential, aspiring Athletes must understand proper posture, balance their movement patterns, build supporting and stabilizing muscle groups, improve mobility, and enhance their coordination. (ref 3)

How we train Strength & Conditioning?

Redline believes in age-appropriate strength and resistance training. We prioritize safety in every movement by focusing on proper mechanics first, followed by consistency, and then intensity.

What is Injury Prevention?

The outcome of the collective training activities consistently performed by an athlete to help him/her avoid major or season-ending injury.

Why is Injury Prevention important?

Athletes want to be able to perform at their best, and they never want to miss out on games or competitions due to injury. Well-rounded Athletes who train their body and movement patterns will be better prepared, more resilient, and able to thrive throughout the demands of a season, postseason and beyond.

How do we train Injury Prevention?

Redline provides a comprehensive and well-rounded program to develop speed, agility, strength, body awareness, movement mechanics, and posture. In all, it’s a great way to help ensure your Athlete stays strong, ready, and on their chosen field of play.

REDLINE COACHING & INSTRUCTION

Redline Coaches have a passion for motivating and developing all Athletes, from the young and emerging to the advanced and elite.

Our coaching staff brings a diverse background of undergraduate and advanced degrees, coaching and training certifications, as well as playing and coaching experiences.

Redline partners with the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NCSA) to support our coaches receiving their Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) certification, which is widely recognized as the gold standard in strength and conditioning.

All our coaches are committed to providing a structured, safe, and highly productive training environment that’s positive, high-energy, and fun!

REDLINE COACHING & INSTRUCTION

Redline Coaches have a passion for motivating and developing all Athletes, from the young and emerging to the advanced and elite.

Our coaching staff brings a diverse background of undergraduate and advanced degrees, coaching and training certifications, as well as playing and coaching experiences.

Redline partners with the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NCSA) to support our coaches receiving their Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) certification, which is widely recognized as the gold standard in strength and conditioning.

All our coaches are committed to providing a structured, safe, and highly productive training environment that’s positive, high-energy, and fun!

Tyrone “TJ” Howell was born and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio. Where he attend Withrow High School. He was a two-sport athlete (Football & Baseball) he received recognition in both sports at the high school ranks ( 1st team All City and 1st team All District in baseball in football ). Coach “TJ” played both sports collegiately at Tiffin University. Shortly after his time in school TJ spent 2013 – 2016 playing professional baseball within the Cincinnati Reds and Pittsburgh Pirates farm systems before signing with the Columbus Lions of the NAL (National Arena League) in 2018. Following the 2018 arena football season, TJ was invited to mini-camp with the Philadelphia Eagles and Detroit Lions before finding his passion in the sports performance field. Since making the transition from athlete to trainer, Coach TJ has operated NFL combine programming as well as NFL vet offseason programs. His new found passion has led him to train athletes like Lavonte David (Super Bowl Champion), Jordan Evans, Adarius Taylor, Devante Bond, DeShawn Williams, Amongst others currently in the NFL or awaiting the 2022 draft process. Along side those two programs, TJ has ran youth speed and agility camps, high school strength and conditioning programs, as well as college offseason programs for various sports (Football, Baseball, Basketball and Soccer) focusing on performance and sport specific training as well as overall speed training. TJ’s goal at Redline is to help kids achieve their athletic goals and present the kids with the mentality that all things are possible through hard work and dedication.

Ramiro “Coach Ram” Trevino is local Texan, born and raised in Pasadena, TX. He attended and played varsity basketball for Pasadena High School. He continued his education with a focus on business management at Praire View A&M where he also earned a spot on their basketball team as a walk on. Coach Ram departed college and played overseas for three years, where he helped two teams in the LNBP win championships. He has coach, trained, and mentored over 100 athletes, coached AAU teams all around the south Houston area, and he loves to volunteer his free time to help youth in his community. Coach Ram also works for the Houston Rockets as a Basketball Camp Lead where he’s had the opportunity to work with and learn from Rockets’ and Comets’ legends, such as NBA Champion Matt Bullard and 4x WNBA Champion Cynthia Cooper, Gerald Green, Moochie Norris, and rookie phenom Jabari Smith. Ramiro’s goals at Redline are to go above and beyond for athletes to make them “Greater than yesterday.”

Yessenia Abigail Ayala, better known as “Abi,” was born in San Diego, California. Shortly after, she moved to Texas in 2008, and when she began high school, she was a two-sport athlete playing varsity and club soccer and running in cross country. She took her school to cross-country regionals and was a two-time MVP award winner. After high school, she attended Texas State University, where she earned her degree in Exercise and Sports Science. During college, she spent her summers providing personal soccer training to young athletes. After finishing college, she now works as an assistant coach for the Houston Dynamo/Dash youth program. Working with this organization has enhanced her ability to adjust each session that will best suit the skill set of any player, whether basic, intermediate, or advanced. Additionally, from being with this program, she has experience coaching various ages and in multiple settings such as camps, clinics, and weekly training sessions. Her goal is to provide athletes with a training experience that will teach them fundamental skills to take their game to the next level.

Uriah “Coach Yuri” West was born and raised in Douglas county, Georgia. He was a three-sport athlete (Football, Basketball, Track & Field ) receiving accolades in mainly football as he was selected to the all state team twice while also rushing for nearly 4,000 yards leading his highschool team to their first playoff berth in 8 years. Coach Yuri went on to play football collegiately at Jacksonville State University; debuting by setting a rushing touchdown record with three touchdowns as a freshman and winning two Ohio Valley Conference championships as a team captain. He then went on to play as a graduate transfer at Rice University for his final season in 2022, helping them reach the Liberty Mutual Bowl and ending a bowl game drought. During his time in college, Coach Yuri also trained and helped mentor kids in his college and home community. He specializes in both football and basketball training. Coach Yuri’s goal is to not only build a great athlete but to also build a happy one as well as he teaches the children how to improve while also having fun working toward their individual goals.

Coach Ed Fairley was born and raised in San Jose, CA. He played basketball through junior high and high school, ultimately going on to earn a spot as a walk-on at San Jose State University. After college, he played in a Pro-Am league in San Francisco for eight years. Coach Ed moved to Chicago in 2003 where he started his personal basketball training business “The Hoopologist;” training kids all around Chicago, including nine Life Time Fitness gyms. He has coached 10 AAU teams, 6 high school teams, and conducted training sessions for hundreds of individuals. In 2016, Coach Ed and his family relocated to the Houston area, his motto is” bring me your best, we will make you better”.

Tyler Zarella is a local athlete born in the League City, TX area. He played both football and baseball for Clear Falls High School where he lettered 1 year on the gridiron and 3 years on the diamond. Having a history of playing as a utility player at Falls he found his calling on the mound. After receiving all-district and all-county recognition he took his career to Alvin Community College where he posted a 3.20 ERA over 45 innings in 2019, earning a spot in the Texas-New Mexico all-star game and 2nd team all-conference honors. Tyler continued his career at Houston Christian University in 2021 where he faced top programs including #10 Texas Tech, Texas A&M, and CWS participant Oral Roberts University. After a rocky first year at HCU Tyler found success out of the bullpen for the Huskies. In 2022 he managed to lead the Huskies on the mound, under head coach Lance Berkman, with a 3.08 ERA over 25 appearances and a WHIP of 1.06. Hitters batted .196 when facing Zarella. In 2023, he completed his career at Tennessee Tech University playing under legendary coach Matt Bragga and the Golden Eagles. Tyler led the Ohio Valley conference in pickoffs and picked up a pair of strikeouts over 1 inning in a 12-5 victory over #19 Tennessee Volunteers. Tyler is now an assistant coach at Alvin Community College.

David (“Coach Dave”) Range was born and raised in Birmingham, AL. He was a two-sport athlete in baseball and football. David started as a true high school freshman in both sports, ultimately going on to play at Lane College during the 2017-2019 seasons. He received his BS degree in Kinesiology with a focus on Exercise Science from the University of Alabama at Birmingham. David also possesses a Performance Enhance Specialist certification. He worked with the UAB football team as student Athletic Trainer and Strength Coach. Dave also interned with the (USFL) United States Football League and the (MLFB) Major League Football as an Athletic Trainer and member of their medical staff. He has relocated to Houston and is excited to help develop young athletes to reach their goals.
